01/08 superhero preview

fantastic four
How The Thing and co. could become part of the X-Universe...
words: chris hewitt

What are you doing on June 9, 2017? If Fox has anything to do with it, you’ll be going to see Fantastic Four 2, the sequel to its reboot of Marvel’s very first superhero team. But that’s far from being a sure thing.

For a start, the first movie hasn’t come out yet (it’s due August 6). Directed by Josh Trank, the wunderkind behind the brilliant Chronicle, the sombre trailers indicate his take on the quartet who gain superpowers after an experiment goes wrong is a world away from the cartoony FF movies of 2005 and 2007. “I wanted to make a movie that focuses on the transformation and the terror and the creepiness of it,” says Trank.

But there may be super-trouble in super-paradise, with rumours of extensive reshoots. If so, it’s hardly surprising: the Fantastic Four is worth a lot for Fox. If they can get it right, there’s potential for interaction with the X-Men, possibly via a wormhole into the world of mutants. “It’s something we think about a lot as I work on Fantastic Four, and it’s part of this X-Men world now,” Simon Kinberg, writer and producer on the film, told us last year. But if it doesn’t hit, there’s a chance that not only will you have to find something else to do on June 9, 2017, but that the rights will revert back to Marvel, as they did with Daredevil. If that happens, expect the FF to become part of the MCU ASAP.

Up Next

THE DC UNIVERSE

Holy share-price surge! On October 15, 2014, Warner Bros. CEO Kevin Tsujihara announced the studio would implement a full universe based on its DC heroes, one hopefully to rival that of Marvel.
